greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Consider the EKG sequence (A064413) started at n instead of 2; a(n) = number of steps before sequence merges with A064413, or 0 if the two sequences never merge.
comment: For the purpose of this sequence, ignore the initial 1 in A064413 and imagine that it begins with the 2.
The upper points appear to occur at primes, the points just below the upper points at twice primes.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=2..3000
Gordon Hamilton, The EKG Sequence and the Tree of Numbers
Gordon Hamilton, Untitled video related to previous video
results.author: _T. D. Noe_ and _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 02 2010
